segments.text: Hey , Ken ... I need to talk to you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Can we step into the conference room ? This is a more private conversation .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok ... I'm just going to lay it all out on the table , What do you think of Vincent's management style ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , Vincent has only been CEO for a couple of years and ... well ... um ...
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't want to put you on the spot . Here's what I'm getting at , I don't think Vincent is the man for the job .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really ? And what led you to this conclusion ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As I see it , he lacks the proper vision . His style is more about survival , and he's not taking the company anywhere.He ' s treading water instead of swimming .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I confess I've had my doubts about his abilities before . It seems he mainly got the job because his famous aunt pulled some strings .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've been with this firm for 26 years and I'd hate to see it go down the drain due to poor leadership skills .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Me too . But what can we do ? This isn't a reality TV show ... we can't just vote him out .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes and no ... We can't ask for a show of hands on who thinks he should be fired , but we can introduce a vote of no confidence at the next board meeting .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Interesting idea . You might be on to something .
segments.speaker: S2
